titleInfo.title: Construction of the U.S. Post Office in Sparta, Tennessee

mods.abstract: Sparta Post Office during construction as a Works Progress Administration (WPA) project. In front of the building are two auotmobiles and a Pinehurst Dairy wagon with mule.

The Postmaster was James A. Farley. The Works Progress Administration (WPA) was a New Deal program designed to put unemployed Americans back to work. Between 1935 and its termination in 1943, the WPA employed approximately 8 million workers. In Tennessee, the WPA built roads, sewer systems, bridges, waterways, dams, viaducts, and overpasses. It also built major airports in Memphis, Chattanooga, Knoxville, Nashville, and at the Tri-Cities of Bristol, Johnson City, and Kingsport.

titleInfo.title: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
